page.title: 02** COMMUNITY FACILITIES **
page.content: In 1920 as a result of the Mining Industry Act for the improvement of social conditions the South Hetton Colliery Welfare Association was formed.In 1927 the committee purchased land for cricket and football which is still in existence and has been extended to include another football pitch,tennis courts and childrens play area. The Community Centre stands in the centre of the village opposite the colliery and occupies premises built in 1895 which were originally the Miner's Institute. The centre provides library facilities and a range of leisure activities including snooker girls club,table-tennis,first aid classes,Bingo,karate,indoor bowls, youth club and toddlers club.
